intro: Delphinium yajiangense, commonly known as the Yajiang larkspur, is a species of flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of China. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are palmately divided, and the flowers are arranged in racemes, adding to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
